description: How about adding an option to write as well instead of just draw?
It is pretty nice and performs its job. I wish the whiteboard was larger though.

summary: This looks promising, but it lacks a text input feature

description: It could be improved of course, but it works for my needs. Thanks so much devs, your work will always be apprecieted.

It has a pen tool, size and color may be changed, basic images insertion, nice graphical interface, lots of customization in settings, styles for headers. Very nice in usage.

Would like:
> moving images between pages
> in settings: toggle default image inversion (It took me a while to discover images can be un-inverted manually)
> images clipping tool (incl. option of permament discard of the excess)
> option of changing the font I write with
> history and layers panes (like in gimp/photoshop)
> possibility to edit the header's styles (N, H1, H2, H3), possibly like in MS Office styles, also to rename them. I usually like 2 headers styles, 1 for text and 1 for special (quotes, descriptions, equations)
> inserting symbols tool (I mean UTF-8 chars)
> option to roll the part between headers, i.e. hiding the chapter's content between the headings
> possibly basic bbcode inline instructions like [calc]2+2[/calc] would show "4"
summary: Has all the basics you need in the beginning

description: I was impressed when found this program on android, windows, and linux. And it has near all features of MS' OneNote.

excellent note taking app
real cross platform
only needs more sync options
and web clipper
let's hope for its development
summary: does not have simple sync option using third different filesyncs
